name: escape / epacse
description: Expands escaped characters (e.g. \n, \r). Strings are not expanded automatically; use this function. Passing [5,13] deletes both because 13 (\r) removes the previous character.

name: l2i
description: Converts a list of digits into an integer (e.g. [3,1,4,1,5,9,2] -> 3141592).

name: i2l
description: Converts an integer back into a list of digits.

name: l2b
description: Base-encodes a list using the given base (e.g. base 64).

name: b2l
description: Decodes a base-encoded list using the given base (e.g. base 64).

name: limit
description: Returns elements from index 0 until n. Useful for infinite lists (e.g. first 10 digits of pi).

name: timil
description: Returns the list with the last n elements removed. Does not work on infinite lists.

name: e2l
description: Finds the nth most likely possible options for an error.
Executes a system command. Returns stdout, stderr, and a list containing the status code.

name: pi
description: Infinite list of digits of pi. Floats do not exist; pi as a float is represented as [[pi],1].

name: args
description: Command-line arguments, each argument represented as its own list.
